metadata.description: AI-generated insights and forecasts for CAG Operations Dashboard
metadata.dataSource: Simulated LLM-style analysis based on emissions patterns
metadata.modelNote: In production, these would be generated by Claude API analyzing actual data

todayInsight.title: Taxi Time Anomaly Detected
todayInsight.description: Aircraft taxi times increased 12% this week due to runway 02L maintenance. This added approximately 18 tCO2e. Expected to normalize by Thursday when maintenance concludes.
dataPoints: Additional fuel burn: ~1.6 kg/min × 1.6 min × 320 = 820 kg/day
todayInsight.recommendation: Consider coordinating with ATC for optimized taxi routing during maintenance period

insights.title: Taxi Time Anomaly Detected
insights.description: Aircraft taxi times increased 12% this week due to runway 02L maintenance. This added approximately 18 tCO2e. Expected to normalize by Thursday.

insights.title: Scope 2 Declining Consistently
insights.description: Terminal electricity emissions have decreased 2.3% week-over-week for the past 3 weeks. The LED retrofit in Jewel appears to be showing results, contributing approximately 4 tCO2e savings per week.

insights.title: T3 F&B Plant-Based Potential
insights.description: Terminal 3 F&B outlets show only 28% sustainable meal transactions vs 45% in Jewel. Analysis suggests 40% conversion potential through targeted promotions, which could reduce tenant emissions by 8 tCO2e/month.

insights.title: CNY Travel Surge Incoming
insights.description: Based on booking data and historical patterns, Chinese New Year period (Jan 28 - Feb 12) is expected to see 24% higher passenger volumes. Projected emissions increase: 380-420 tCO2e for the period.

insights.title: T2 Transit Lounge Overcooling
insights.description: Temperature logs indicate T2 transit lounge HVAC is set 2°C below optimal comfort range during night hours (11pm-5am). Adjusting to 24°C could save approximately 3 tCO2e per week with no passenger impact.

insights.title: CarbonMax Engagement Improving
insights.description: Quest completion rate increased from 38% to 42% this month. The introduction of the Hydration Station quest in transit areas appears to be driving engagement, particularly among transit passengers.

insights.title: Weekend Jewel Emissions Spike
insights.description: Saturday and Sunday Jewel emissions are running 18% higher than weekday averages, driven by retail HVAC demand during peak visitor hours. Consider implementing demand-response cooling strategies.

recommendations.action: Optimize taxi routing during runway maintenance
Engage top 5 F&B tenants in T3 on plant-based menu promotion
Adjust T2 transit lounge HVAC night schedule
Implement demand-response cooling in Jewel during weekends
Expand SAF promotion in CarbonMax app ahead of mandate

forecast.methodology: Time series analysis with day-of-week seasonality and event adjustments

scenarios.name: SAF reaches 2% adoption
scenarios.description: If SAF blend increases from current 0.8% to 2% by Q2 2026

scenarios.name: 50% F&B plant-based adoption
scenarios.description: If 50% of F&B transactions shift to plant-based options
assumptions: Meat meal: 2.5 kg CO2e, Plant meal: 0.7 kg CO2e

scenarios.name: Full LED retrofit across all terminals
scenarios.description: Complete LED lighting replacement in T1, T2, T4 (Jewel and T3 already done)

scenarios.name: Electric GSE fleet conversion
scenarios.description: Convert 80% of ground support equipment to electric
assumptions: Current GSE emissions: ~400 tCO2e/year (part of Scope 1)
Electric GSE charged from Singapore grid

suggestedQuestions: Why did emissions spike on Tuesday?
Which airlines improved efficiency this month?
Predict next week's emissions if flight count stays same
How much could we reduce if all tenants reached B rating?
What's the impact of the runway maintenance?
Compare weekend vs weekday emission patterns
Which aircraft types are most efficient?
